body:
Comment 3: 
Godoc works by analyzing the source files (w/o semantic analysis) as opposed to say, 
reading the export information found in a binary file; as a result, the presentation of 
exported identifiers simply shows the source definition.

Alternative presentations may be useful and possible in the future (for instance, the 
suggested approach is similar to what an Oberon "Browser" might show since it reads 
the "symbol file" of a compiled file).

godoc works differently. As a consequence it cannot show substituted values as 
suggested (in general, an exported constant value may be imported from some other 
package). On the other hand it can show the "interface" of a package before a 
package can be compiled (for instance because packages it depends on are not yet 
compiled).

This works as intended.
_Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
